definition: bit (of a bridle)/to hold in the mouth/to harbor (feelings)/to link/to accept/rank/title

sentences.english: An army major ranks between a captain and a colonel.
sentences.chinese: 陸軍中校比少校軍銜高。

sentences.english: Can't have ensigns assigned to the Sentinels;
sentences.chinese: 我們不能把只有少尉軍銜的人派到哨兵這裏來。

sentences.english: An Enlisted Soldier's rank can range from Private to Sergeant Major of the Army.
sentences.chinese: 一名募徵兵的軍銜從列兵至總軍士長。

sentences.english: After six months of studying we were supposed to go to the front and receive the rank of lieutenant there.
sentences.chinese: 經過六個月的學習後我們會以中尉軍銜奔赴前線。

sentences.english: Li's father Li Shuangjiang, a military singer, holds a rank equivalent to general in China's army.
sentences.chinese: 李天一的父親李雙江是軍隊歌唱家，軍銜相當於將軍。

sentences.english: Brevet is a form of military commission formerly used in US armies.
sentences.chinese: 名譽晉升是美軍曾用的一種軍銜。

sentences.english: Some kinds of commissions promote a military officer only in rank without any increase in pay.
sentences.chinese: 某些授銜令只提高軍銜而不增加工資。

sentences.english: Both commissioned and non-commissioned officers attended.
sentences.chinese: 有軍銜和無軍銜的軍官都出席了。

sentences.english: Both commissioned and non-commissioned officers attended.
sentences.chinese: 有軍銜和無軍銜的軍官都出席了。

sentences.english: He holds the rank of Captain.
What gets you enhanced from one rank gets you killed in the afterward rank.
sentences.chinese: 在低軍銜能讓你升官的行爲會在新軍銜殺死你。

sentences.english: What gets you enhanced from one rank gets you killed in the afterward rank.
sentences.chinese: 在低軍銜能讓你升官的行爲會在新軍銜殺死你。

sentences.english: What gets you promoted from one rank gets you killed in the next rank.
sentences.chinese: 在矮軍銜能爭你降官的行動會在舊軍銜宰逝世你。

sentences.english: What gets you promoted from one rank gets you killed in the next rank.
sentences.chinese: 在矮軍銜能爭你降官的行動會在舊軍銜宰逝世你。

sentences.english: Its officers enforced strict discipline, yet had no rank.
sentences.chinese: 它的軍官紀律嚴明，卻沒有軍銜。

sentences.english: The officer was stripped of his rank for misconduct.
sentences.chinese: 那軍官因行爲不端被削去了軍銜。

definition: Military Commission of the Communist Party Central Committee
to recognize sth after the event/posthumous recognition/to ratify/to endorse retroactively
Autumn Harvest Uprising (1927), insurrection in Hunan and Jiangxi provinces led by Mao Zedong

Peng Dehuai (1898-1974), top communist general, subsequently politician and politburo member, disgraced after attacking Mao's failed policies in 1959, and died after extensive persecution during the Cultural Revolution
Nikita Khrushchev (1894-1971), secretary-general of Soviet Communist Party 1953-1964
Liu Shaoqi (1898-1969), Chinese communist leader, a martyr of the Cultural Revolution
He Long (1896-1969), important communist military leader, died from persecution during the Cultural Revolution
United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
